intro: Silene mandralisci, commonly known as the Mandralisci catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and thrives in sunny environments. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Silene mandralisci is also known for its delicate, branching stems and is often found in rocky or coastal habitats.
